dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 1098 IH: Traumatic Brain Injury Reauthorization Act of 2013
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Pascrell (for himself and Mr. Rooney) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize certain programs relating to traumatic brain injury and to trauma research.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Traumatic Brain Injury Reauthorization Act of 2013.

section.header: CDC programs for prevention and surveillance of traumatic brain injury
section.text: Section 394A of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 280b–3) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the section heading and all that follows through For the purpose and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: To carry out sections 393B and 393C, there are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary for each of fiscal years 2014 through 2018.

section.header: State grants for projects regarding traumatic brain injury
section.text: Section 1252 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300d–52) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking , acting through the Administrator of the Health Resources and Services Administration,; and
in subsection (j), by striking 2012 and inserting 2018.

section.header: State grants for protection and advocacy services
section.text: Section 1253 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300d–53) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking , acting through the Administrator of the Health Resources and Services Administration (referred to in this section as the Administrator),;
in subsections (c), (d)(1), (e)(1), (e)(4), (g), (h), and (j)(1), by striking Administrator each place it appears and inserting Secretary;

subparagraph.text: by striking Administrator of the Health Resources and Services Administration and inserting Secretary; and
by striking by the Administrator and inserting by the Secretary; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (l), by striking 2012 and inserting 2018.

section.text: Section 1261(i) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300d–61(i)) is amended by striking 2012 and inserting 2018.
